_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
1/21/26 2:50 PM Update:  Good afternoon skiers and riders! It was another bluebird day on the mountain. Our grooming crew is absolutely crushed it and the groomers are riding surprisingly well especially when things started to loosen up. A lot of our snow has taken an early spring vacation, so expect limited terrain open and stay alert for rocks, stumps, and other hidden debris just under the surface. Tomorrow is looking clear and warm again. If you time it right, there are some really fun turns to be had. Join us tomorrow and enjoy another day of clear skies and sunshine!

Join us at the Summit House for our Pray for Snow Party January 24th from 12-3pm. This includes a live DJ and giveaways every 30 minutes. You may even win an original REX chair from 1988. Pop down to Rafters for Happy Hour from 3-5pm. Stay a bit longer and enjoy our Snow Glow Disco from 5-8pm. Slide, shimmy, and shake your way down the mountain to disco beats, LED lights, and a live DJ! 

Terrain Parks: The Discovery Park and Arwine's Jump Line are open today!

Campbell Basin will be open for snacks, beverages, and restrooms only today.

Midway Yurt will close at 2pm today.

PARKING UPDATE
Well folks, some things dont always go as planned. After continued coordination with our third-party parking support team, weve made the decision to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season.
Moving forward, parking reservations will be capped at a set number and offered on a first-come, first-served basis. This change is intended to provide more clarity and consistency for guests planning their day on the mountain. 
 
We truly appreciate your patience and understanding as weve worked through a rockier-than-usual start to the season. Your feedback, flexibility, and continued support mean a great deal to us, and we remaincommitted to improving the guest experience and keeping your days on the mountain as smooth as possible. For more information and to book your future reservation visit our Parking and Shuttles Webpage  

Notes for today:
  1. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  2. Parking Reservation cancellations are always required if you're not planning on making it up. No-show policy applies. Do your part to ensure everyone has access to the mountain. Thank you! Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations.
  3. Jumpstart your new year with these new deals!  We're kicking off a full month celebration of our founding year, 1962, with $62 now every Tuesday and Thursday through the end of the month.
  4. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Offered on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift quicker and more laps faster. 

Mountain Weather 1/21/2026 4:00pm
Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: More dry weather is on the menu for the next couple of days. Temperatures are on a slow decline, bottoming out on Friday, with freezing levels looking to hit the 5k mark. This, coupled with some light North winds, could make for some chilly conditions on the mountain. This slight pattern change is associated with a weak front moving through, not likely to produce any snowfall, just a swing in temperature. 

Wednesday Night:  
Sky Cover: Mostly Clear
Freezing Elevation: 9,000
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light North
Thursday: 
Sky Cover: Mostly Clear
Freezing Elevation: 7,000
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light with Moderate North gusts
Thursday Night:  
Sky Cover: Partly Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 5,000
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light North

Outlook: Friday may have a bit of a nip to the wind, with chilly East gusts in the mid-20s. Looking ahead to the weekend, temperatures should warm back up slightly, but the moderate winds may still linger, keeping the snow surfaces firm and fast. 

Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Uphill travel is no longer permitted into Southback for the remainder of the season. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 


25/26 WINTER PRODUCTS & PASSES

  • NIGHT SKIING HAS BEEN EXTENDED FOR THE 25/26 SEASON! FROM 28 to 53 NIGHTS! Read full announcement 
  • Daily lift tickets are now on sale, plus $62 Tuesday's are NOW DOUBLED! Every 2nd and now 4th Tuesday of the 25/26 season, ride for only $62! Lock in your holiday plans, or your next trip with savings you can't beat. Purchase Day tickets here! 
  • Performance Ski, Snowboard and Beginner Rental Pass: ON SALE NOW! 
  • Tune Pass: Premier and Base available for purchase!
  • Demo Pass: Lock in the best gear of the 25/26 season with unlimited use!
  • 25/26 3-Day Midweek & Anytime Passes: Your pass to the perfect powder day, groomer day or when conditions are right for you. Purchase today and gear up for a rad winter.
  • Afternoon Pass: With extended night skiing dates, take your Afternoon Pass to the next level!

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Chair 6 will be delayed daily for snow surfaces to loosen up. Gold Hills, Northway, and Quicksilver will remain closed. 

Uphill Travel Status: PERMITTED - Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.
